podcast_episode.name: Episode 285 - A History of Things Powerful and Evil
podcast_episode.description: <p>Our new best friend Eckart Dayhammer gives us a brief history of the Circle of Seven and about how lots of things are real bad right now. But, we know now that our quest leads us to Grol a city in the Shadowfell. Since things are bad like, everywhere we enlisted the aide of our former adventurer pals/ scary boat captain to help collect info while we are venture into the dangerous unknown. Hopefully the Shadowfell will be chill and fun but we need to be prepared for when we return. If we return...</p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/sanderdoesart" target="_blank">@sanderdoesart</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 283 - Once More into the Bone Cage
podcast_episode.name: Episode 283 - Once More into the Bone Cage
podcast_episode.description: <p>When suspects flee the scene of a crime you gotta throw them into the - Bone Cage. That is how justice is served in a helpful non-lethal way. Plus these two knuckle heads had something to do with the disappearance of a god, so that is a huge no-no in pretty much every realm. But they are very powerful, but will they be powerful enough to destroy the bone cage? Who knows!? The bone cage is vague and loose in game stats so you just kinda gotta wing it. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/bridgitconnell" target="_blank">@bridgitconnell</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 282 - A Tavern at the End of Heaven
podcast_episode.name: Episode 282 - A Tavern at the End of Heaven
podcast_episode.description: <p>Finding Pelor is extremely important, we can all agree, but so is making sure the orcs don't overrun Elysium. That is a ticking clock with Gruumsh's face all over it. While we are not powerful enough to take on Gruumsh we are powerful enough to find clues to Pelor's wheareabouts. We can talk to people who run Laundry Mats in heaven! We can argue with guards! We are heroes. Sometimes being a hero means kidnapping our favorite meat seller to help with our plans. Sometimes. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Oni_shiri" target="_blank">@Oni_shiri</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 280 - Dragon Siege
podcast_episode.name: Episode 280 - Dragon Siege
podcast_episode.description: <p>Meanwhile in Pelor's Hope a huge problem has befallen the good Queen Ashayara which requires the help of some of her old allies. Something odd must be going on with the strongest entities in the realms since it seems like they are all riled up and ready to fight whatever they can. What can rile up the gods...it is terrifying to think about. Surely it can't be a coincidence, right? Something bananas has to happening in the various hells and abysses and heavens to cause such calamity on the mortal realm. But that is why we have heroes - to stop really bad things from happening. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 279 – A Complicated Heaven
podcast_episode.name: Episode 279 – A Complicated Heaven
podcast_episode.description: <p>Turns out one of the more important aspects of Elysium is missing. It is kinda like going to Disneyland and finding out Mickey Mouse was murdered...After weighing our options I guess we are the ones to solve this problem especially since this cursed orb keeps bringing us to terrible places. Sure, all of this is very difficult but if we heroes don't do something then I guess everyone will die? Maybe? I am pretty sure the leaders of hell would not be super chill as rulers. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Oni_shiri" target="_blank">@Oni_shiri</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.name: Episode 278 - Heaven Can Wait
podcast_episode.description: <p>Having narrowly avoided the sea of Gruumsh's massive army we now have to deal with those pesky bad bois who are climbing over the wall right in front of us. Sure, enemies are swarming everywhere but we are here and I think we can help this section. And then who knows, maybe we can help the next section too! And then the next. Or we could solve larger problems and avoid this large war...yeah let's do that.</p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/chulllie" target="_blank">@chulllie</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.name: Episode 277 - Welcome to Elysium
podcast_episode.description: <p>Time to go to literal heaven. We are sure that nothing bad will happen in literal heaven. Time to kick back and relax and drink whatever Pelor and his buds drink. Probably some sort of like...wine made out of...grapes. I almost feel bad for how easy this next step in our Orb Mystery will be. podcast_episode.name: Episode 276 - Becoming the Greatest in All the Lands
podcast_episode.description: <p>Hello and welcome into our home. Our home is an actual play Dungeons & Dragons podcast. Cozy, huh?! Listen as we level up to level 17 and prepare our next adventure. Our fun and weird Orb is itching to bring us to a new plane where I gotta assume nothing bad will happen. We are going to literal heaven. Pelor runs a tight ship so I am confident we will be fine. But can our heroes survive the most stressful encounter yet - Performance Reviews.</p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/devinbillyart" target="_blank">DevinBillyArt</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.name: Episode 275 - An Unquenchable Thirst (GeeklyCon 2018 Live Show)
podcast_episode.description: <p>We recorded this episode live from the Lincoln Theater in Columbus Ohio! We had such a wonderful time in an honest to goodness theater. The staff even helped us with fancy lav mics!! It ruled. Listen as your heroes aide a pal who has lost their stick. What dangers will they face? What magical tricks will be played on the poor players who are definitely smart and good at Dungeons & Dragons? </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.name: Episode 274 - Queen of the Feycourt
podcast_episode.description: <p>The statues resonate with destructive power yet our heroes muster all their strength knowing that if they fail then all of the Feywild, and possibly all realms, will fall. As the waters rise so due their personally held fears that they are not strong enough to aid Melora in her time of need. Some other heroes should have handled this. Fighting all these minions of Lolth is way more stressful than brewing potions in the Tower of Grey.</p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by<a href="http://www.geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=2045&start=30#p10584" target="_blank">Dgriffon325</a>! podcast_episode.name: Episode 273 - Marbled Madness
podcast_episode.description: <p>As we draw ever nearer to the sound of battle and the overwhelming, yet hard to place, power emanating from this Fey Castle we know that some truly awful stuff is going to greet us. Just, ten gallons of bad in a 8 gallon jug. Thank the gods that other heroes from the planes seem to be assisting us or else we would turn into adventurer slime.</p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Mathews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>)!  </p><p>Podcast art by<a href="http://www.geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=2045&start=30#p10584" target="_blank">Dgriffon325</a>! podcast_episode.name: Episode 272 - One Step Closer to the Gods
podcast_episode.description: <p>Having defeated and befriended those pesky Drow, your heroes now must enter seat of the Fey Court. Sounds of battle can be heard raging throughout the corpse strewn halls but we must press on! Finally, we will learn some answers about what the heck is going on. Well, at least we hope so. podcast_episode.description: <p>We knew that getting into the tower was going to be hard but honestly we kinda hoped that whatever was in the lake was going to be the worst of it. We had no idea that a supreme fighting force would get in our way. Luckily, the Tower of Grey is also a Supreme Fighting Force so they better get their pants tied tight because a skill based challenge beat down is coming their way! </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our regular editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>), and also our junior editor Alan Matthews (<a href="https://twitter.com/JAlanMathewsJr" target="_blank">@JAlanMathewsJr</a>) - this is his first episode, so let me know what you think!  </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Rattenkaefig" target="_blank">@Rattenkaefig</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 269 - The Writhing Mass Under the Lake
podcast_episode.name: Episode 269 - The Writhing Mass Under the Lake
podcast_episode.description: <p>Was the lake sounding the tower always writhing in that menacing way? This really is a shame since we want to travel across the lake but I gotta tell ya I don't look forward to figuring out what the hell is beneath the water. I suppose it could be a school of harmless fish? Oh. Oh no nevermind I saw something poke out that was positively not "fish-like". Today is going to be horrible.</p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! We were joined by <a href="https://twitter.com/matthewmmorris" target="_blank">Matthew Morris</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/Animat3dM3" target="_blank">Carly Shields</a>! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/_wrenfro" target="_blank">@_wrenfro</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 268 - The Orcus Onslaught Part 2
podcast_episode.name: Episode 268 - The Orcus Onslaught Part 2
podcast_episode.description: <p>The Circle of Seven continues their fight against Orcus and his undead minions. Fortunately, this is the most hardened crew of god-slayers in all the realms so if anyone can bring down the dreaded Orcus it is them. But at what cost...</p><p>This was recorded as a part of our 24-hour International Tabletop Day stream using level 20 characters taken from the soon to be released "Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes". Thank you so much to Wizards of the Coast for allowing us to join in on the Podcast of Foes! </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! We were joined by <a href="https://twitter.com/matthewmmorris" target="_blank">Matthew Morris</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/Animat3dM3" target="_blank">Carly Shields</a>! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/BrotherToasty" target="_blank">@BrotherToasty</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 267 - The Orcus Onslaught Part 1
podcast_episode.name: Episode 267 - The Orcus Onslaught Part 1
podcast_episode.description: <p>What do you do when the natural order of the realms falls in to chaos? Good and evil must exist in harmony so when Orus threatened to disrupt that balance the Archmage Bigby sent for the strongest, meanest and most Demon-Lord vanquising-est adventures around - The Circle of Seven. But will their power be enough to slay the Prince of Undeath in his realm?</p><p>This was recorded as a part of our 24-hour International Tabletop Day stream using level 20 characters taken from the soon to be released "Mordenkaine's Tome of Foes". Thank you so much to Wizards of the Coast for allowing us to join in on the Podcast of Foes! </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/D_R_White_" target="_blank">@D_R_White_</a>! podcast_episode.name: Episode 266 - A Mailbag Episode!
podcast_episode.description: <p>Due the to busy or sick state of the cast this week we chose to lean into the weird and do another mailbag episode! Thank you to all the folks who wrote in, mainly on twitter, to ask us questions. We could have chatted for 13 hours but we knew we had to save some questions for the future. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/BrotherToasty" target="_blank">@BrotherToasty</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 265 - Towards the Banks of Fate
podcast_episode.name: Episode 265 - Towards the Banks of Fate
podcast_episode.description: <p>Getting your biscuits smashed by some rude enemies is enough to make even the strongest and bravest heroes pause for a moment and assess their situation. Unfortunately for our heroes, the longer they wait the longer young Prince Thom Harper remains in his captors grasp. But there sure do seem like a lot of Drow around these parts. And the friend we have met along the way seem to both be avoid the area we are going. This should be fun. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/dirtymm86" target="_blank">@dirtymm86</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 264 - The Big and Brave Ben Dilladong
podcast_episode.name: Episode 264 - The Big and Brave Ben Dilladong
podcast_episode.description: <p>After escaping the fierce Drow Warriors, our heroes must decide he next plan of attack. They have little time to decide since Thom Harper is still in peril. But...it serves Thom no good if his would be rescuers die in the process. Unfortunately we also do not know what dangers hide within the Astral Plane...it is just so weird. But have no fear for the Tower of Grey shall not be toppled so easily! </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/WolfishGrin_21" target="_blank">@WolfishGrin_21</a>! podcast_episode.name: Episode 259 - Welcome to the Feywild
podcast_episode.description: <p>Looks like some sort of funny business is going on in the Feywild. We don't really want to go to the Fey Lands, especially without a guide...but we have to try to track down Thom Harper! Plus this dang, weird Orb! What is its deal? I kinda hate it. I am sure we won't die in the Feywild since we are strong and all, but what if we are only strong for our realm...oh god I hate this. </p><p>The adventure continues with Skud Derringer (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Lahnik "Lahni" Caplain (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/rayeliann" target="_blank">@rayeliann</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 253 - Tower of Grey (Start of Arc 3)
podcast_episode.name: Episode 253 - Tower of Grey (Start of Arc 3)
podcast_episode.description: <p>It has been seven years since the Lich, Sinu the Red, was defeated. The lands of Drunkeros have more or less been at peace. Sure, no one has done anything about Pyre, the ancient red dragon who controls Mastwick. And occasionally a goblin tribe will harass trading caravans or some poor mercenaries may find themselves turning to the other side of the law. But, the scars of the past are being healed. Deephome is prospering under Queens Aludra and Jaela's rule. Pelor's Hope has opened trade to the far corners of the realm under Queen Ashayara Dayne's stern, but loving care. The monkey village is still really happy that Bonanas Foster is gone. </p><p>We find our heroes, Rowan Grey and Toby Treacletart, in the town of Greenham where they have founded an adventurers league or heroes guild if you want to avoid potential brand confusion. Surely, nothing stressful or odd will happen to them and they can live out the rest of their days in relative bliss. Wouldn't that be boring.</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editor David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)! </p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/killurmonkey" target="_blank">@killurmonkey</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 248 - Hashtag Bride Tribe Part 2
podcast_episode.name: Episode 248 - Hashtag Bride Tribe Part 2
podcast_episode.description: <p>We continue to party and take several trips down memory lane. We are also introduced to the hottest, newest Drunkeros sport. But really, we are all here to celebrate the union of Aludra Wyrmsbane and Jaela, the two greatest gals in this fantastical world. Their wedding gives me hope. It gives me joy. And most importantly, if gives me an excuse to drink a few too many drinks and dance the night away in Deephome.</p><p>One party is BMed (Bachelorette Master) by Toby and the other is BMed by Steve. As the parties are happening at the same time we will be going back and forth between each party. Please enjoy responsibly. (The episodes were recorded with all of Jaela's party and then all of Aludra's and David spliced them together. We were...much, much drunker in the Aludra party bits since it was an hour or so later.) </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/theZachNoll" target="_blank">@theZachNoll</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 246 - Dance of Undeath Part 2
podcast_episode.name: Episode 246 - Dance of Undeath Part 2
podcast_episode.description: <p>Quiet. So quiet. After that undead terror, Sinu the Red, uttered but a word Steve fell to the ground using his last ounce of strength to ensure that he did not fall onto his baby which he brought into battle with a beast so strong it is on the cover of both the Dungeon Masters Guide as well as Tomb of Annihilation. Sound escapes him as he is no longer able to hear his two allies scream in unison once they realize what has just happened. Steve is used to death, unfortunately. Why should he be spared its cold grasp just because he has repeatedly cheated the gods of death? A hero deserves more. A hero deserves vengeance.</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@devinbillyart</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 244 - Welcome to Tarry Hallow
podcast_episode.name: Episode 244 - Welcome to Tarry Hallow
podcast_episode.description: <p>Finally, some clues we can use to get closer to the truth of this accursed town! Seriously, why do these simple folk have to be so guilty? I am not saying we are the world's greatest detectives but you have to admit that everyone seems a little...off, right? A place like this is liable to turn a good person into a paranoid wreck. The truth feels like it is just a clue or two away. If we could just catch a small break I am sure everything will come to light. Hopefully Teddy is still ok...</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/thedogleech" target="_blank">@IForgetHisName</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 243 - Where Bones Lie
podcast_episode.name: Episode 243 - Where Bones Lie
podcast_episode.description: <p>The mystery of this town gets a little deeper but definitely not clearer. It is hard to help but think that everyone in this town is hiding something from us. Surely, they can't all be guilty...regardless of how suspicious each person appears our goals are to look past it and find Teddy. He is important to finding the Lich and finally easing the undead blight upon this land. Is the Mayor in on it? Is the head of the town guard? What about Teddy's family...Everyone is a suspect. Everyone. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 241 - The Actual Diary of Sinu the Red, Seriously This Time
podcast_episode.name: Episode 241 - The Actual Diary of Sinu the Red, Seriously This Time
podcast_episode.description: <p>Finding the diary of a crazed wizard is a tough thing. Do you read it? Do you read it extra carefully because the wizard may have put strange arcane spells within the dusty pages? You have to read it, of course. There is just too much potential knowledge that you just have to ignore the danger and barrel forward. Libraries and Books are the true dangers of our world, not those pesky dragons or dank dungeons.</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 239 - Into the Crypt Yet Again
podcast_episode.name: Episode 239 - Into the Crypt Yet Again
podcast_episode.description: <p>The Crypt of Sinu the Red is one of the top 10 places you just don't go in this world. It may be empty, but various nasties have called that area home over the years so you never really knows what could be in there. Plus, we already know that Denton's boss went in and hasn't come out yet, which is probably bad. But, we will go in anyways. We must save this town!</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Floyd_jpg" target="_blank">@Floyd_jpg</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 238 - For the Kids
podcast_episode.name: Episode 238 - For the Kids
podcast_episode.description: <p>Having defeated the army of the dead, the gang starts to learn more about this strange, unfortunate town. As things often go, the plight of the town is summed up by one scared girl asking to find her brother. We are heroes. We are the light in the darkness. We will find this child. Probably. Hopefully it doesn't take to long since the zombies will probably come back the next night. Being a hero sucks. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 237 - Defend These Walls, Ye Living Basterds
podcast_episode.name: Episode 237 - Defend These Walls, Ye Living Basterds
podcast_episode.description: <p>The horizon quakes with the sound of buzzing flies and the ground hums with impending doom. The Lich must know we are coming for the undead army sent to stop us is as fearsome as it is massive. Fear not! Your adventurers are hearty. They are swarthy. They are...good at magic and shooting arrows!</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 236 - Journey to the Land of the Undead
podcast_episode.name: Episode 236 - Journey to the Land of the Undead
podcast_episode.description: <p>After leaving Aludra, the gang prepares for their journey to face this nasty Lich. Traveling means one thing for our stalwart adventurers - Downtime Activities! Listen as we have one training montage after another of getting pumped and ready to fight some skeletons. Sidebar - undead are the coolest creatures to fight in D&D right? </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey(<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/red_fathom" target="_blank">@red_fathom</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 235 - Queendom Come
podcast_episode.name: Episode 235 - Queendom Come
podcast_episode.description: <p>I hate goodbyes but I love tricking out airships so this very special episode causes me a lot of emotions. It is finally time for Aludra to hang that warhammer up and focus on ruling her people. With her semi-retirement (no one believes she will be gone forever) the last of the five sordid adventurers who stumbled their way out of Shadowspar Keep has given up on the adventuring life. Aludra was the lucky one to be still alive, that is for sure, but ruling a divided Dwarven people will not be heavenly bliss. She will be missed but definitely not forgotten. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 234 - A Vampire Friend
podcast_episode.name: Episode 234 - A Vampire Friend
podcast_episode.description: <p>We find ourselves in a reconstructed Pelor's Hope. About four years ago or so. More of our friends were still alive but the wounds from the deaths of others were much fresher. Who do we turn to when it appears like we have no allies that we can trust? Would you make a deal with a monster to protect your people? Lord Titus Harper wants to find out. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Rowan Grey (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Lord Titus Harper (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Floyd_jpg" target="_blank">Floyd_jpg</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 233 - A Very Special Mail Bag Episode
podcast_episode.name: Episode 233 - A Very Special Mail Bag Episode
podcast_episode.description: <p>With another arc in the bag our team realized that the bag mentioned earlier in this sentence was actually a mail bag! So, being smart and kind we opened it and realized that it was you, the smarter and kinder fans, who sent in the mails which gave said previously mentioned bag its name!</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="http://www.geeklyinc.com/forums/search.php?author_id=4670&sr=posts" target="_blank">BrotherToastyCakes</a> on the forums! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.filename: Drunks and Dragons - Dungeons and Dragons 5e Actual Play - Episode 233 - A Very Special Mail Bag Episode.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Podcast of Annihilation Bonus Episode - The Curious Cure of the Black Orchid
podcast_episode.name: Podcast of Annihilation Bonus Episode - The Curious Cure of the Black Orchid
podcast_episode.description: <p>What do you do when your great leader falls sick to an unknown illness? Would you brave the dangers of Chult in order to save her? What if you knew you would find strange riddles and even stranger allies? Well, fair adventurers, we hope you packed an extra set of swamp bug repellent for your heroes are hopping on the next boat to Lost City of Omu!</p><p>We hope you enjoyed our Tomb of Annihilation episode as much as we were terrified while recording it. Seriously, ToA felt dangerous from the very moment we cracked the pages, and we didn't even fight a Zombie T-Rex. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.filename: Drunks and Dragons - Dungeons and Dragons 5e Actual Play - Podcast of Annihilation Bonus Episode - The Curious Cure of the Black Orchid.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Episode 232 - A Slight Gravitational Problem
podcast_episode.name: Episode 232 - A Slight Gravitational Problem
podcast_episode.description: <p>Well, we did it. Sometimes success is the difference between you or your foe getting off their signature move. Some days you get the drop. Other days, heck, your enemies must have eaten their fiber bars because they move like a dancer on speed. Now that we got the drop on Jett we have to deal with a slight...gravitational problem. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Floyd_jpg" target="_blank">@Floyd_jpg</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 231- Jett Razor
podcast_episode.name: Episode 231- Jett Razor
podcast_episode.description: <p>The time has finally come to face the traitorous Jett Razor. I hate that guy so much. Luckily, we looked some pretty powerful items to assist us in this fight. Hopefully Jett doesn't have similarly powerful items...wait...this is his city. Oh man he is totally going to have like a rocket launcher or something. Well, wish us luck!</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/IForgetHisName" target="_blank">@IForgetHisName</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 230 - Shrine Time
podcast_episode.name: Episode 230 - Shrine Time
podcast_episode.description: <p>Time to split the party to see how the gang handles challenges by themselves. Each member of our team, plus Tug and Elenor, must pull their weight and not goof up or else all of Glaine, the Jewel of the East, could die! Plus, surely Jett knows his former friends are probably up to something weird, which gives him plenty of time to prepare for us. This all seems like a bad idea...</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Rattenkaefig" target="_blank">@Rattenkaefig</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p><p><br></p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 229 - A Power Reborn
podcast_episode.name: Episode 229 - A Power Reborn
podcast_episode.description: <p>Our heroes are well on their way to saving everyone in both a stylish and brave way. Their fame will surely be spread far and wide across the lands. Surely, that won't have any downsides, right? Well at least they get some fun loot from the Armory in Nareev which will make any future complications less complicated.</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p><p>This week’s episode is brought to you in part by <a href="https://www.squarespace.com/" target="_blank">Squarespace</a>: Start your free website or online store trial at <a href="http://squarespace.com/" target="_blank">squarespace.com</a>, and when you launch your custom site use offer code “dragons” to save 10%</p><p>This episode is also brought to you by <a href="https://www.blueapron.com/dragons" target="_blank">BlueApron</a>: Check out this week’s menu and get your first three meals free – with free shipping – by going to <a href="http://blueapron.com/dragons" target="_blank">blueapron.com/dragons</a></p><p>And finally, this episode is also brought to you by <a href="http://mackweldon.com/" target="_blank">Mack Weldon</a>: Get 20% off when you use offer code "DND" at check out.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 228 - Traps and Treasures
podcast_episode.name: Episode 228 - Traps and Treasures
podcast_episode.description: <p>With Nareev steadily falling to the warm and inviting location we like to call 'The Ground" the gang has to frantically solve their current gravity issues. The lives of tens of thousands of innocent people and thousands of more-or-less innocent goo people rest in the hands of our heroes. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/YourDarlingSon" target="_blank">@YourDarlingSon</a>! podcast_episode.title: Episode 227 - We All Fall Down
podcast_episode.name: Episode 227 - We All Fall Down
podcast_episode.description: <p>Oops. Looks like we really need to grab those items that our good friend whats her name mentioned. The whole "Bringing back Solani" thing made us more or less not trust all of her ideas. That is on us. But we have to move fast if we want to save Glaine, the Jewel of the East! Hopefully there aren't many hindrances between us and that book and hat!</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Dekren" target="_blank">@Dekren</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p><p>This week's episode is brought to you in part by <a href="https://www.squarespace.com/" target="_blank">Squarespace</a>: Start your free website or online store trial at <a href="http://squarespace.com/" target="_blank">squarespace.com</a>, and when you launch your custom site use offer code "dragons" to save 10%</p><p>This episode is also brought to you by <a href="https://www.blueapron.com/dragons" target="_blank">BlueApron</a>: Check out this week’s menu and get your first three meals free - with free shipping - by going to <a href="http://blueapron.com/dragons" target="_blank">blueapron.com/dragons</a></p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 226 - The Temple of Solani
podcast_episode.name: Episode 226 - The Temple of Solani
podcast_episode.description: <p>With the mighty fused-together Voltrox defeated, your dudes head into the Temple of Solani to save Glaine, the Jewel of the East. I hope moving all of Nareev is easy. That would be real great. Like, maybe the Orb of Whatever is just super easy to figure out. I can't imagine anything bad will happen if we just kinda try to wing it. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/ibplunderin" target="_blank">@ibplunderin</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 225 - Defenders of Nareev
podcast_episode.name: Episode 225 - Defenders of Nareev
podcast_episode.description: <p>The Temple of Salanae stands in front of our brave heroes. A thought scratches at the back of each of their minds - are we ready to face the defenders of this sacred place? What terrible defenders block our way? Luckily, past these doors the means to move Nareev will finally be in their hands. This whole goopy mess can put behind them and the traitor Jett Razor can be punished. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/thedogleech" target="_blank">@thedogleech</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 224 - Welcome to Hell (GeeklyCon 2017 Liveshow)
podcast_episode.name: Episode 224 - Welcome to Hell (GeeklyCon 2017 Liveshow)
podcast_episode.description: <p>This episode was recorded live in front of an audience at GeeklyCon 2017! We were all dolled up in our outfits and oh did we have just the best time! It was a little sweaty but the surprises kept on rolling so we didn't mind the heat anyways. Oh yeah, it was hot because we went to HELL!!! How are we going to get out of this one?!? </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 223 - The Fighting Falcons
podcast_episode.name: Episode 223 - The Fighting Falcons
podcast_episode.description: <p>In order to save our good bud Yazdir from the Nareevians, our brave heroes must face a huge and powerful enemy. An enemy with big ol' spikes! Luckily, the gang has a few tricks up their sleeves and this prickly foe is about to enter pain city USA.</p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Coalbee84" target="_blank">@Coalbee84</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p><p>Music: "Epic" by Bensound.com"</p>
podcast_episode.author: michael@geeklyinc.com (GeeklyInc.com)

podcast_episode.title: Episode 222 - Plan C.5
podcast_episode.name: Episode 222 - Plan C.5
podcast_episode.description: <p>With the planning phase behind us, it is now time to get down to business. But, we have some time to kill so we attempt to give the entire town depression. A heroes work is never done. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="http://www.geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=10077#p10077" target="_blank">Shiny Vulpix</a> on the forums! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>
podcast_episode.author: michael@geeklyinc.com (GeeklyInc.com)

podcast_episode.title: Episode 221 - A Quest to Save the Great Leader Part 2
podcast_episode.name: Episode 221 - A Quest to Save the Great Leader Part 2
podcast_episode.description: <p>Y'all ever get that felling like you are in a cheesy action film? Maybe it is the man with the eye patch. Or maybe it is the blaring guitars in the distance but I will tell you what, this whole "Save Cheryl she has been kidnapped" thing sounds familiar. Luckily we have our new Ettin ally (...allies?) to help us with any potential hurdles. And since we are only about half way through our story their has to be some sort of conflict or rising action before we get to the sweet release which is the denouement we all crave.</p><p>Also, a special thanks to <a href="https://twitter.com/holdenators" target="_blank">Holden </a>and <a href="https://twitter.com/BestJakeYoung" target="_blank">Jake </a>from the <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/wizard-and-the-bruiser/id1153017150?mt=2" target="_blank">Wizard and Bruiser</a> podcast for joining us on this adventure! </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/hugodraws" target="_blank">@hugodraws</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 220 - A Quest to Save the Great Leader Part 1
podcast_episode.name: Episode 220 - A Quest to Save the Great Leader Part 1
podcast_episode.description: <p>Our rowdy monster crew gets let in on a secret tip that someone very important to them has been snatched. Knowing in their Monster Hearts that leaving the Atlanta Falcons alone is possibly a cowardly action, saving their leader is the most important thing they could do at this time. Cheryl is the most important Gnoll in the World of Drunkeros and by the scales of Semuanya she will be saved!</p><p>Also, a special thanks to <a href="https://twitter.com/holdenators" target="_blank">Holden </a>and <a href="https://twitter.com/BestJakeYoung" target="_blank">Jake </a>from the <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/wizard-and-the-bruiser/id1153017150?mt=2" target="_blank">Wizard and Bruiser</a> podcast for joining us on this adventure! </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Rattenkaefig" target="_blank">@Rattenkaefig</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? podcast_episode.title: Episode 219 - My Friend, the Dragon
podcast_episode.name: Episode 219 - My Friend, the Dragon
podcast_episode.description: <p>When you meet a new friend you just have to establish a baseline level of trust. Trust is so important these days, what with the dreaded Nareevians taking the shape of potential new friends but they are actually trying to siphon off the magical energies from a nice Elven city and overthrow a city that is often times described as a "Jewel of the East." And, yes, this baseline trust can be the wholesale murder of your enemies, but be sure to keep it within reason. </p><p>The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (<a href="https://twitter.com/themikebachmann" target="_blank">Mike Bachmann</a>), Aludra Wyrmsbane (<a href="https://twitter.com/jennifercheek" target="_blank">Jennifer Cheek</a>), Jaela (<a href="https://twitter.com/Nika_Howard" target="_blank">Nika Howard</a>), Toby Treacletart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/timlanning" target="_blank">Tim Lanning</a>) and your Dungeon Master (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/thriftynerd" target="_blank">Michael DiMauro</a>). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (<a href="https://twitter.com/stephokingston" target="_blank">@stephokingston</a>) and David Stewart (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/spudcam" target="_blank">@spudcam</a>)!</p><p>Podcast art by <a href="https://twitter.com/IForgetHisName" target="_blank">@IForgetHisName</a>! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/drunksanddoodles" target="_blank">#DrunksAndDoodles</a> or head on over to the <a href="http://geeklyinc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=29&t=1819&p=9684#p9684" target="_blank">forum</a>.</p>

podcast_episode.title: Episode 218 - A Poorly Named Movement
podcast_episode.name: Episode 218 - A Poorly Named Movement
podcast_episode.description:
A mysterious stranger meets up with our daring adventurers as they are trying to figure out this strange airship. Will this be a friend? Will this be a foe? The suspense has rendered my body into a jello like paste. I would be at home at a Nareevian pool party, I am so nervous!
The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (Mike Bachmann), Aludra Wyrmsbane (Jennifer Cheek), Jaela (Nika Howard), Toby Treacletart (Tim Lanning) and your Dungeon Master (Michael DiMauro). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (@stephokingston) and David Stewart (@spudcam)!
Podcast art by @bridgitconnell! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with #DrunksAndDoodles or head on over to the forum.

podcast_episode.filename: Drunks and Dragons - Dungeons and Dragons 5e Actual Play - Episode 218 - A Poorly Named Movement.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Episode 217 - The Secrets of the Captain's Quarters
podcast_episode.name: Episode 217 - The Secrets of the Captain's Quarters
podcast_episode.description:
All great plans must answer a single question that is often overlooked - how the hell are you going to extract yourself from your current pickle that you have created for yourself? And this is where we find our heroes in today's adventure. Sure, you could be tempted to assume they only wanted this airship because it was cool. That even now they are not considering it a vital part of their plan. You could even dare to suggest that they just stumbled upon something cool and now they simply want to steal from Jett adding insult to injury. How dare you! Our heroes are professionals. They are wise and thorough. They just are. I think they are stealing the booze now, but that is a part of the plan too.
The adventure continues with Steve Melloncamp (Mike Bachmann), Aludra Wyrmsbane (Jennifer Cheek), Jaela (Nika Howard), Toby Treacletart (Tim Lanning) and your Dungeon Master (Michael DiMauro). Don’t forget to follow our editors Steph Kingston (@stephokingston) and David Stewart (@spudcam)!
Podcast art by @bridgitconnell! Want the world to see your fan art? Tweet it with #DrunksAndDoodles or head on over to the forum.
podcast_episode.author: michael@geeklyinc.com (GeeklyInc.com)

podcast_episode.description: <p>On this week's episode of Sneak Attack!, the gang makes their way on to Arlan's boat in attempt to find or destroy the portal crystal. podcast_episode.name: Episode 56 - A Perfect Time For a Murder
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this week's episode of Sneak Attack!, the gang must regroup after Akio blew their chance at impersonating Drom, the half-orc first mate of Arlan's transport ship. podcast_episode.name: Episode 55 - The Best Laid Plans

podcast_episode.description: <p>On this week's episode of Sneak Attack!, the gang is finally back in one place, albeit having changed and grown throughout the fracture. With all four of them in Brightcove, will they be able to follow through with Taegan's plan, or would Draagus convince them to follow him instead? podcast_episode.name: Episode 53 - Freefall
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this week's, one year anniversary episode of Sneak Attack!, Sherwood and Greaek continue their aerial struggle as they make their way to the city of Brightcove, hoping to reunite with Brenna and Akio. podcast_episode.title: Episode 52 - Fly Away Home
podcast_episode.name: Episode 52 - Fly Away Home
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this weeks episode of Sneak Attack!, the sky-bound duo fights for their life against two Gryffin-riding warriors of Arlan Brampton. They are desperately trying to get to Brightcove to meet up with Brenna and Akio before they need to scuttle Arlan's plans to send a portal crystal off-island. Will they be able to complete the heist in time? Will Greaek and Sherwood find them before it's too late? Find out now!</p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks everyone for listening! podcast_episode.name: Episode 51 - Take to the Skies
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this weeks episode of Sneak Attack!, Akio and Brenna get one step closer to completing their mission, while Greaek and Sherwood struggle to catch up to their friends. How much longer must the group be separated, and will they be able to stop Arlan's forces? Find out right now!</p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks everyone for listening! podcast_episode.title: Episode 50 - On the Trail
podcast_episode.name: Episode 50 - On the Trail
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this brand new episode of Sneak Attack!, Sherwood and Greaek regroup after barely escaping the mysterious dwelling of the fish people who live under the Willow Peaks. Meanwhile, Brenna and Akio leave Gianni's house with their newly acquired horses and make their way to Brightcove in an effort to track down Arlan's powerful crystal. Will they find the gem before it is too late, and will Greaek and Sherwood ever make up their lost ground? Find out now!</p> <p> </p> <p>A HUGE thank you to everyone who has made fifty episodes of Sneak Attack! possible. I am overwhelmed with love from our listeners, and truly appreciate it. You make all of us want to do this show every week. You can drop us a line on Twitter @SneakPodcast, or email us at <a href= "mailto:sneakattackpodcast@gmail.com">sneakattackpodcast@gmail.com</a>. podcast.name: Brute Force
podcast.description: Brute Force is a real-play comedic RPG podcast blended with in-character narration. We play a campaign of FATE Core (we started with World of Darkness) set in the high fantasy world of Eorith. The adventurers are a party of monsters tasked with saving a world that barely tolerates their existence.

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 110 – Going Tinklies
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 110 – Going Tinklies
podcast_episode.description: In the aftermath of Mort's salted assault on Vrymm's Acting Regent Ilztrek Filifar, the party is split.
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 110 – Going Tinklies.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 109 – The Wiener’s Circle
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 109 – The Wiener’s Circle
podcast_episode.description: After winning the Vrymm International Supercross Tandem Waterskiing Death Race, Hollis and Cammy have earned entry into the palace. Leland and Mort join them for a fancy banquet in their honor, and several sidebars occur.
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 109 – The Wiener’s Circle.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 108 – Sharked the Jump
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 108 – Sharked the Jump
podcast_episode.description:
The Brute Force have a kingdom to save, but when the opportunity arises to fulfill one of Hollis's lifelong dreams, everything else is put on hold.
This episode was recorded as part of the GeeklyCon DIGI live show.
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 108 – Sharked the Jump.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 107 – Hardtack and Parmesan
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 107 – Hardtack and Parmesan
podcast_episode.description: The Brute Force lays low after their daring prison break and plan their next steps. In the process, Cammy takes a peek beyond the veil of Mort's mind.
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 107 – Hardtack and Parmesan.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 106 – Inferno Hearts 3: Final Destination
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 106 – Inferno Hearts 3: Final Destination
podcast_episode.description: The Good Guy Squad are having a titanic adventure, but when Johnny Wasabi reveals himself to be a treacherous enemy from their past, it’s up to Carol, Jeff, and Talulah to seas the day! If you wish to support the show and get access to our Patron exclusive Discord channels, livestreams, and our side campaign …
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 106 – Inferno Hearts 3: Final Destination.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 105 – Inferno Hearts 2: The Next Chapter
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 105 – Inferno Hearts 2: The Next Chapter
podcast_episode.description: The Good Guy Squad have little time to appreciate the luxurious accomodations on the Fairfax, as the windows and doors in their rooms quickly lock shut. Their cruise has begun. The destination: Revenge!
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 105 – Inferno Hearts 2: The Next Chapter.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Brute Force – Episode 104 – Inferno Hearts
podcast_episode.name: Brute Force – Episode 104 – Inferno Hearts
podcast_episode.description: The Good Guy Squad returns as Carol, Jeff and Talulah win an essay contest promoting Jasper Spitwhistle's newest book: Hearts of Inferno. The grand prize? An all-inclusive cruise to a tropical island featured in the book alongside the author himself. But not everything is what it seems!
podcast_episode.filename: Brute Force - Brute Force – Episode 104 – Inferno Hearts.mp3
